poem:
### Sea Bream

The sizzle whispers  
on the pan—a quiet  
alchemy of sunlit lemon,  
herbs whispering secrets.  
Capers pop and burst  
in a butter-smooth harmony.  
A dance of flavors  
meets the fleeting  
moment, where fish is  
not just fish  
but a strand of soul  
caught and served,  
light as air.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Georgina Hayden’s recipe for sea bream with herby lemon and caper burnt butter Frying a piece of fish has a bit of a bad rep, and I’m not really sure why; you can have a deeply delicious and light meal in less than 10 minutes (though that, of course, also depends on its accompaniments). If I don’t want anything too hearty, I’ll often serve it with greens or a salad, so it really is a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
